com.mygdx.runnjump.game

Class Hud

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.runnjump.game.Hud
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

    public class Hud
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    This class represents the in-game UI the player sees while actually playing the level.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage
      The Stage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hud(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, Runnjump theGame, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin skin)
      The constructor creates the layout and determines weather to render the android specific HUD or desktop, depending on which device is running the app.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      this method disposes of all the resources, to prevent memory leaks.
      void gameOver(int score)
      This method prints the game over messages onto the hud, informing the player he can play again.
      void gameWon(int score, int level)
      This method similarly to the game over method prints the game won messages onto the screen/hud informing the player that he has successfully completed the level.
      com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Button getJumpBt()
      getter for the android jump button

      getter for the touchpad
      void setLives(int lives)
      this method is used to update the lives displayed on the ui.
      void setScore(int score)
      this method is used to update the score displayed on the hud.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hud

        public Hud(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
           Runnjump theGame,
           com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin skin)
        The constructor creates the layout and determines weather to render the android specific HUD or desktop, depending on which device is running the app.
        Parameters:
        batch - the batch
        theGame - the object representing the app itself
        skin - the skin used for the buttons, labels and other ui elements

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver(int score)
        This method prints the game over messages onto the hud, informing the player he can play again. It gets score so it can be printed.
        Parameters:
        score - the score

      • gameWon

        public void gameWon(int score,
                    int level)
        This method similarly to the game over method prints the game won messages onto the screen/hud informing the player that he has successfully completed the level.
        Parameters:
        score - the score
        level - the level
